[[Country music|Country]] | occupation = Singer-songwriter | instrument = Vocals, guitar | years_active = 2004 â€“ | label = | associated_acts = | website = {{url|sambakermusic.com}} }} '''Sam Baker''' (born 1954) is an American [[folk music|folk]] musician based in [[Austin, Texas]].{{cite web |url= http://www.allmusic.com/artist/sam-baker-mn0001881021 |title= Sam Baker |last= Leggett |first= Steve |publisher= [[AllMusic]] |accessdate= May 6, 2014}} He writes sparse poetic lyrics that have gained him acclaim from other notable folk artists such as [[Gurf Morlix]] and [[Fred Eaglesmith]]. ==Biography== Sam Baker was born in 1954 in [[Itasca, Texas]]. He attended [[Itasca High School (Texas)|Itasca High School]], where he played varsity football with fellow musician [[Tommy Alverson]].{{cite web |url= http://www.tommyalverson.com/bioprint.html |title= Tommy Alverson bio |publisher= Tommy Alverson |accessdate= May 7, 2014}} In 1986, Baker was traveling by train to [[Machu Picchu]] in Peru when a bomb placed on a luggage rack above his head by the [[Shining Path]] guerrilla group exploded, killing seven other passengers including the three people who had been sitting with him.{{cite news |url= http://www.today.com/id/24794227/ns/today-today_entertainment/t/singer-sam-baker-true-survivor/ |title= Singer Sam Baker is a true survivor |work= [[Today (U.S. TV program)|Today]] |date= May 23, 2008 |accessdate= May 6, 2014}}{{cite news |url= http://www.austinchronicle.com/music/2007-11-16/561471/ |title= Terrible Beauty: The ballad of Sam Baker |first= Doug |last= Freeman |date=November 16, 2007 |newspaper= [[The Austin Chronicle]] |accessdate= May 6, 2014}} Baker was left with numerous injuries, including brain damage, a cut artery, and blown-in eardrums.{{cite web |url= http://www.huffingtonpost.com/steven-rosen/sam-bakers-remarkable-new_b_3837739.html |title= Sam Baker's Remarkable New Album |last= Rosen |first= Steven |work= [[HuffPost]] |date= August 30, 2013 |accessdate= May 6, 2014}} His injuries required 17 reconstructive surgeries.{{cite news |url= http://www.chron.com/entertainment/music/article/Surviving-tragedy-makes-Sam-Baker-s-songs-resonate-1525499.php |title= Surviving tragedy makes Sam Baker's songs resonate |last= McClelland |first= Eileen |date= February 10, 2006 |newspaper= [[Houston Chronicle]] |accessdate= May 6, 2014}} He has a constant case of [[tinnitus]] and the fingers of his left hand were left gnarled. He did retain enough dexterity to grasp a guitar pick and over time, re-taught himself to play his guitar left-handed. In a radio interview in 2020, Baker said his brain injury affected his use of language and he struggled to remember nouns. Writing helped him relearn. At the same time he was influenced by the music of [[Lightning Hopkins]] and his writing became songwriting as he discovered melody.{{cite web |url=https://www.mixcloud.com/richard-leader/leaders-american-pie-3-february-2020-the-one-with-sam-baker/ | title= Leader's American Pie with Sam Baker |date= February 3, 2020 |accessdate= March 12, 2020}} Previous to the bombing, Baker had worked as a bank examiner and whitewater river guide.{{cite web |url= https://www.npr.org/2013/08/27/216176074/sam-bakers-say-grace-is-at-once-beautiful-and-broken |title= Sam Baker's 'Say Grace' Is at Once Beautiful And Broken |date= August 27, 2013 |last= Christgau |first= Robert |authorlink= Robert Christgau |publisher= [[NPR]] |accessdate= May 6, 2014}} ==Music== Sam Baker's music has been compared to that of [[John Prine]]. Baker's 2013 album, ''Say Grace'', was listed by ''[[Rolling Stone]]'' as one of the top 10 country music albums of 2013.{{cite journal |url= https://www.rollingstone.com/music/lists/10-best-country-albums-of-2013-20131210/sam-baker-say-grace-19691231 |title= Sam Baker, 'Say Grace' |series= 10 Best Country Albums of 2013 |date= December 10, 2013 |last= Hermes |first= Will |journal= [[Rolling Stone]] |accessdate= May 6, 2014}} In his review of ''Say Grace'', Jim Fusilli wrote "In Mr. Baker's tales, the personal becomes universal through his keen-eyed writing, supported by well-chosen instrumentation and what might be called spoken-word melodies."Fusilli, Jim. [https://online.wsj.com/news/articles/SB10001424127887324823804579017412103872376 Sam Baker: Bard of the Workaday World.] ''The Wall Street Journal'', August 20, 2013. Among Baker's influences for his songwriting are [[Ken Kesey]], [[William Faulkner]], [[Ernest Hemingway]], and [[Bob Dylan]], and fellow Texans [[Lightnin' Hopkins]], [[Guy Clark]], and [[Townes Van Zandt]].{{cite journal |url= http://www.nodepression.com/profiles/blogs/a-converstion-with-sam-baker |title= 'say grace': A Conversation With Sam Baker |date= August 18, 2013 |last= Bogerd |first= Hal |journal= [[No Depression (magazine)|No Depression]] |accessdate= May 7, 2014}} ==Painting== Sam Baker took up painting after he began songwriting. ==Discography== :{|class="wikitable" !Year !Title !Record Label |- |2019 |''Horses and Stars (Live)'' |Self-release |- |2017 |''Land of Doubt'' |Self-release |- |2013 |''Say Grace'' |Self-release |- |2009 |''Cotton'' |Music Road Records |- |2007 |''Pretty World'' |Blue Lime Stone Records |- |2004 |''Mercy'' |Self-release |- |} ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.sambakermusic.com Sam Baker] (official website) * [https://www.npr.org/2014/05/06/310089151/sam-baker-finding-grace-in-the-wake-of-destruction "Sam Baker: Finding Grace In The Wake Of Destruction"] interview on NPR's ''[[Fresh Air]]'' *[http://www.walesonline.co.uk/lifestyle/showbiz/texan-singer-sam-baker-how-1809707 "Texan singer Sam Baker on how surviving a terrorist bomb changed his life"] from ''[[Wales Online]]'' {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Baker, Sam}} [[Category:1954 births]] [[Category:American country singer-songwriters]] [[Category:Country musicians from Texas]] [[Category:Folk musicians from Texas]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Singers from Austin, Texas]] [[Category:People from Itasca, Texas]] [[Category:Singer-songwriters from Texas]]
